data.title: MGT

data.author: svlentink
data.description:
Navigation watchface for the Netherlands.
This app uses the api from 9292.nl.
It uses the location from your phone as starting location and your defined destination as finish.

How it works.
You specify what your destinations are and it shows the bus, train, ferry or metro you have to take to get there.
E.g. on workdays in the morning, it should route you to work and the remaining time it should route you home.
This personal schedule for locations and time frames is set on the settings page.

The GUI of this watchface is not its strongest, e.g. the B stands for bus, the W stands for walk etc. Please support this project on Github.
data.title: 9292 ov

data.description: Known as 'The Evergreen Game', watch as this famous chess match between Adolf Anderssen and Jean Dufresne unfolds right on your wrist throughout your day. The chess match resets at midnight and a move is made every half hour. Only time will tell if Jean Dufresne learns from his mistakes, or if he is destined to lose until the end of time.

data.description:
All new for the 2016 season:
-Support for Pebble Time Round
-Shake to Show Broadcast Information
-Improved Battery Life
-New Bases Display

With MLB live faces you'll never miss the action of Major League Baseball all summer long!

Customizable to any of the 30 teams, MLB live faces will provide you with:

Before the Game:
-Start Time
-Starting Pitchers
-Broadcast Information

During the Game:
-Score
-Inning + Half
-Who's on first, what's on second, I don't know's on third
-Outs

After the Game:
-Final Score

While a game is in play, the watch face will load data every minute to keep you up to date on the action.  When there isn't a game going on, the watch face will only update every 15 minutes to 1 hour to conserve battery life.

latest_release.release_notes: -Updated Dodger's logo

changelog.release_notes: Added new APPID for openweather.org

Bugfixing

Under the hood
- Better handling of weather icons

Work in progress
- Settings page (temperature scale choice).

Inspired by "Minimal Clean" by Kunal Gautam (Link : pebble://appstore/557eb7fcbb3773ef7d000008).
Added bluetooth status (with vibration on disconnect).
Through openweathermap i've added:
Location (up center), actual temperature (Celsius - left bottom corner), actual weather icon (left bottom), actual weather description (bottom center), next weather icon (forecast 3h) (right bottom) and next temperature (forecast 3h).

This watchfaces updates weather infos every 30 minutes or when shaked.

Thanks to Kunal for the base code and inspiration.

data.description:
Inspired by "Minimal Clean" by Kunal Gautam (Link : pebble://appstore/557eb7fcbb3773ef7d000008).
Added bluetooth status (with vibration on disconnect).
Through openweathermap i've added: 
- Location (up center)
- Actual temperature (Celsius - left bottom corner)
- Actual weather icon (left bottom)
- Actual weather description (bottom center)
- Next weather icon (forecast 3h) (right bottom)
- Next temperature (forecast 3h). 

This watchface updates weather infos every 30 minutes or when shaked. 

Thanks to Kunal for the base code and inspiration.
Thanks to Little Gem Software (Trekv2 watchface) for the weather icons
Thanks to Turner Vink (Vacation Time) for the "update on tap" idea.

data.author: Choong-Soo Lee

changelog.release_notes: - The hourly vibrations are disabled when Quiet Time is active.

- Compiled with SDK 4
- Added support for Emery (Pebble Time 2)
- Added "Thickest" option for hour and minute hands
- Fixed a bug where Pebble Health warning showed up when Pebble Health feature is not used.
- Crushed a bug regarding a custom location change and cache.
- Fixed a bug where the watch face could spam weather requests when seconds and/or second hand is enabled.

Weather updates failed on Sep. 19, 2016 because of exceeding weather update rate limit at Open Weather Map API. This update is to push an emergency fix to lower the rate by utilizing a cache of weather data retrieved. Hopefully, it works!
- Minor bug fixes
- Compiled with SDK 4.0 with support for Diorite platform

- More background colors enabled
- Colors for tick marks
- Limit hourly vibration to certain part of the day
- Pebble Time Round support added

- Battery bar (ascii version) is added
- More Pebble health information (distance in kms and miles) added
- Squashed more bugs!

- We hit the free limit use of Open Weather API! Thanks for the overwhelming support!
- The watchface is updated in the hopes to spread out the weather update requests to stay under the free limit.
- Added the daily steps as one of the data to be displayed.
- Hourly vibration option added
- Fixes an issue where settings and weather do not work on Pebble Classic and Pebble Steel
- Fixed the inability to save a custom location for weather updates

- Color customization added
- Bug fixes
- Fixed a minor display issue with seconds

- Fixed an issue where the weather updates were failing
- Minor bug fixes

- Typos corrected
- Minor bug fixes
Minor bug fixes
- Fixed a bug where the watch face was constantly requesting weather update, resulting in a major battery drain in both the watch face and the phone.

data.description:
Based on an Apple watch face.
- Digital and analog time
- Hour and minute hand width settings
- Optional second hand and digital display
- Digital day of week, month and day
- Configurable information in each corner
  -- Battery life % (* shown when charging)
  -- Battery bar
  -- Current temperature (C or F)
  -- Current weather condition description
  -- Current city
  -- Current wind direction and speed (m/s or mph)
  -- Relative humidity (%RH)
  -- Atmospheric pressure (kPa)
  -- Daily steps (Pebble Health)
  -- Daily distance (miles or km) (Pebble Health)
  -- or nothing!
- Current weather condition icon (optional)
- Optional bluetooth connection status
- Bluetooth connection vibration settings
- Background options (black / white)
- Color customization
Thanks for all your encouragements, comments and suggestions!

latest_release.release_notes: - The hourly vibrations are disabled when Quiet Time is active.

data.title: iClone

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views.   Configuration changed to use Pebble Clay - configuration changes supported whether or not the phone is connected to the Internet.
Add configuration option to show/hide seconds - hiding to conserve battery.
Fixed problem where unable to disable date after enabling it.   Switched to Clay configuration.

Adds configurable date option: no date (default), MM/DD or DD/MM format

data.description:
Identity Crisis!

This poor watch has a problem: it doesn't know if it’s analog or digital. It wants to be both, but it can’t be 100% one or the other. It has a split personality, and jumps over massive hurdles to get by with its personality problem. It ends up being exactly half analog and digital – and needs major psychotherapy to rectify the tension created by its dual personality. 

Fortunately for the user, telling the time is easy!
There is logic to how the hours and seconds (and optional date) get displayed, but it seems crazy!

Hours: Large Digits
Minutes: Physical Hand
Seconds: Small Digits or Partial Analog Hand

Configuration options:
 Date - no date (default), MM/DD or DD/MM.
 Seconds - show (default) or hide.
  
Version 3 adds support for Pebble Time Round.
    
The first two screenshots are animations (the first with date) showing:
(1)   9:59:55 to 10:00:05
(2) 10:40:25 to 10:40:35
The other screenshots show:  
(3) 7:58:34    (4) 8:02:32    (5) 10:17:15

Design from the Tokyoflash Design Studio, created by Dietrich Faust.   The watchface has been produced with the designers' permission, and sanctioned by Tokyoflash. 

The original design can be found here:  
http://blog.tokyoflash.com/2012/07/24/identity-crisis-watch-for-those-with-split-personality/

If you like this, give it a heart and checkout other sanctioned Tokyoflash watchfaces I've published - click on "More from this Developer".

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views.   Configuration changed to use Pebble Clay - configuration changes supported whether or not the phone is connected to the Internet.

data.title: Identity Crisis

data.description:
Tide watch showing state of tide (Australia only) - hours to high & low tide and when shaken, up-coming & previous tide levels. It also shows the time! Use the Settings page to select the location to view & to permanently display tide levels. Note that viewing tide information for a location in a different timezone from where you are located will result in incorrect time to next tide being displayed. 

If you need another (Australian) location added, email & let me know.

The tide levels work as follows. On the side of the clock where the tide hand is (The Rising/Falling indicator makes this clear close to the high/low times) the levels are the previous level & the next level.  On the other side, are the levels of the following tide.  The up-coming level & the start level of the next tide are (of course!) always the same.

If you are showing Fort Dennison, the yellow dot on the tide hand indicates the magnitude of the tidal flow (difference between high/low). High flows have the dot near the outer end of the tide hand. This number (tidal coefficient) is not available from the BoM so is approximated

The extra segments at the 6 hour mark remind you that some tides exceed 6 hours. The hand will only move below 6 hours.

Note that this data must not be relied on for navigation purposes.

In using this WatchApp, you are making use of tide predictions kindly provided by the Bureau of Meteorology. Please refer to & comply with the following page of copyright, disclaimers and usage information:

http://www.bom.gov.au/oceanography/projects/ntc/nsw_tide_tables.shtml

latest_release.release_notes: Update to cope with changed tide web site format

data.title: Tide Watch (Australia)

data.description:
This series of watchfaces for the inexpensive pebble watch show you the current human population* (up to the minute) and much more.

New Features in Version 2.01
-59 Watchfaces
- Accelerometer triggered Nitro
- High Visibility Battery Gauge

The Only Team
Yankees, Mets, Red Sox, Jets, Patriots, Manchester, Liverpool it's all a construct. Sometimes we need a reminder of the game and what the teams really are. Inspired by gifted philosophers like Joe Rogan and Duncan Trussell.

I built an app because my "human teammates" built a watch and then this whole software around it - that lets you make apps. I did it using Pebble's native C based SDK on PebbleCloud using Github. Powerful Community! 

Creating customized, data-driven watch faces for social good is just something I do for our team. I love our team. 

I'll be honoring Team Human representatives with custom watchfaces and notifying them via twitter. There is no money in making these FREE watchfaces for me. It's for the benefit of our team.


*Calculations made based on estimates from wikipedia

latest_release.release_notes: -Accel triggered Nitro Boost

data.title: Team Human

data.description:
This watchface is for K-Pop Secret fans. She is HyoSeong, leader of Secret. All the photos here are taken by ZandyJack, HyoSeong's Instagram and processed using watch face generator created by Paul Rode.
Functions:
1) Display time, date and battery level
2) Different color display for battery level.
3) When disconnected from Bluetooth, the watch will vibrate and the display time will be dark gray color. When connected to Bluetooth, the display time will be white color.
4) Random background picture when back to the watchface.
5) There are 5 background pictures and will change every minutes.

changelog.release_notes: Fixed an issue where the time could be displayed like 11:?? (font was a bit too large). Added an AM/PM indicator when using the 12h clock display and made the date label a bit higher so the comma is fully displayed.
Bolder time font for better readability and added a comma after the day abbreviation.
Initial release :)

data.description:
Easy Time is a watchface that lets you read the time with ease! How often does someone ask you the time and you look at your precious Pebble Time and you see 11:17 and have say eeh, it's 11:15!? Easy Time truncates the time in five minute blocks and shows 9 bars (on the top and bottom) which will indicate the exact minute, so you can still see what time it is exactly with ease :)

The watchface shows the approximate time, the actual minutes (in bars), the date (with abbreviated day name) and the battery percentage of your Pebble Time.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed an issue where the time could be displayed like 11:?? (font was a bit too large). Added an AM/PM indicator when using the 12h clock display and made the date label a bit higher so the comma is fully displayed.

data.description:
Simple watch face based on LIMITTMM by Albert Salamon. This version in black include weather, date, bluetooth battery status. Larger centre number is the current hour. As explained in LIMITTMM, each line represents a five minute period. Medium sized line represents quarter. Long line stands for half hour. More colour options and added settings coming soon. Version 1.1 include option to use Fahrenheit.
Version 1.2 include new white theme.
Version 1.3 new settings screen, better persistence.

Based on the not-particularly-popular 24 Hour Day-O-Matic, comes the 12 Hour Day-O-Matic!

Brought to you by request, the 12 Hour Day-O-Matic does exactly the same thing as the 24 Hour version, except the whole 24 hour thing. 

Many many many improvements coming soon! Send suggestions to me, and maybe you'll see it in a future iteration or fork. Thanks for looking!

data.author: Marcello Brivio

changelog.release_notes: Upon popular request, temperature is now available in Farenheit degrees, too.

The short story: the "Loading..." issue on temperature and weather is now fixed. Enjoy!
The long story: starting on October 9th, OpenWeatherMap is requiring an API Key for their services to be invoked by external apps. I didn't get any warining, so I didn't noticed the bug untill some Pebble Verbose Watchface users wrote me about it. Sorry for this. Everything should be OK now.
New Feature: now the color combination is inverted (dark text on clear background) when the Pebble is not connected to your phone, giving you a more immediate view of the Bluetooth connection status.

- Added support for Basalt SDK: now you can install this watchface on Pebble Time!
- Minor bug fixing
Minor update for improved text positioning.
First official release, tested and running on my black Pebble ;-)

data.description:
In this watchface you won't find beautiful graphics or cool typography to please your eyes: only data, displayed with a terminal-inspired look & feel for the little nerd living inside everyone of us...

The Verbose Watchface displays in a single Pebble window all the following informations:

- 24 hours clock
- 12 hours clock
- Seconds
- Date
- Weekday
- Yearly week number
- Yearly day number
- Watchface uptime (tip: refreshing the watchface you can use this to start a simple time counter!)
- BlueTooth connection status
- Battery level %
- Temperature and conditions for your location (data from openweathermap.org) updated every 30 minutes.

Is this enough?

latest_release.release_notes: Upon popular request, temperature is now available in Farenheit degrees, too.

data.title: Verbose Watchface for Pebble

data.author: Patrick Van Cauteren

changelog.release_notes:
Major upgrade.

On popular request you can now choose between 10 different color schemes.
Seconds can be shown as well (as a bar that crawls from left to right).
Keep the suggestions coming.
Solve some minor bugs.
Solved a problem where the step target was only recalculated in the first paint event.

Health bar is now configurable.  You can show the daily step average of last week, or a configured target.

Keep the suggestions coming!
Removed distance.

Guido asked to get a step counter on the watch face.
Here it is: the number of steps and the walked distance in meters is shown.

Richard asked to be able to configure a white background.
Here it is: just select white background in the configuration screen.
Solved color problem in battery status visualization.
Slightly changed battery state visualization.

Corrected some incorrect characters in Spanish, Norwegian and Danish.
Bluetooth-connection-circle is now shown as 11th circle instead of 10th circle.

Added support for Danish, Norwegian and Swedish.

If BlueTooth is disconnected, a small red circle is shown in the bottom-right corner.

Follow-up of PVC's Biggy.

Just like my Essentials and Biggy, it is intended to for people that just need the essential information (time, day of the week, day of the month, battery status) and prefer a bigger font.

Differences with Biggy are: the fonts are bigger, slightly changed layout, bluetooth status is not shown here (since this is most of the time active anyway).

Supported languages for the weekdays are: English, Dutch, French, German, Spanish and Italian.

data.description:
Intended to for people that just need the essential information (time, day of the week, day of the month, battery status) and prefer a bigger font.  Choice of 10 different color schemes.

Supported languages for the weekdays are: English, Dutch, French, German, Spanish, Italian, Danish, Norwegian and Swedish.

The health bar shows the number of steps today, and can be extended with the daily step average of last week or a chosen target.

latest_release.release_notes:
Major upgrade.

On popular request you can now choose between 10 different color schemes.
Seconds can be shown as well (as a bar that crawls from left to right).
Keep the suggestions coming.

data.title: PVC's Biggy Too

data.author: Oliver Merkel

changelog.release_notes:
Configurable watch face:

* Show the second-hand (on / off);
* Minute-hand behavior (sweep / tick)

Configuration settings are persistent. With second-hand off and minute-hand just ticking the watch face will use tick timer service in MINUTE_UNIT (lower power consumption).

data.description:
"DOWN THE RABBIT-HOLE.
... when suddenly a white rabbit with pink eyes ran close by her.
There was nothing so very remarkable in that; nor did Alice think it so very much out of the way to hear the Rabbit say to itself, "Oh dear! Oh dear! I shall be too late!" ... but when the Rabbit actually took a Pebble watch out of its waistcoat-pocket, and looked at it, and then hurried on, Alice started to her feet, for it flashed across her mind that she had never before seen a rabbit with either a waistcoat-pocket, or a Pebble watch to take out of it, and, burning with curiosity, she ran across the field after it, and was just in time to see it pop down a large rabbit-hole under the hedge."
... from Lewis Carroll's "Alice in Wonderland".
Trust this watch face and you will most likely be 5 minutes too late! THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND... even if you are too late. Have fun...
The White Rabbit being part of the background image is work from John Tenniel.
John Tenniel illustrated early editions of Lewis Carroll's "Alice in Wonderland" back in 19th century.
Mind that works of John Tenniel and Lewis Carroll are in the public domain yet!
All other portions of this Pebble watchface are MIT licensed.

latest_release.release_notes:
Configurable watch face:

* Show the second-hand (on / off);
* Minute-hand behavior (sweep / tick)

Configuration settings are persistent. With second-hand off and minute-hand just ticking the watch face will use tick timer service in MINUTE_UNIT (lower power consumption).

data.title: Oh dear! Oh dear! I shall be too late!

initial upload

data.description:
A watchface based off the 'Megaman advanced pet'. requested by reddit user 'lukeisawesome12' on /r/BattleNetwork/ This is a very basic, animated watchface,
it supports 12hour (am/pm time) as well as 25 hour, and the frame changes every 3 seconds, in the future, you will be able to change that, but for now that is the set time.
all the images are from the manual, so the quality is a bit low, but it looks MUCH better on a real watch!
-------------------------------
NOTE: this is NOT a replacement for the Black&white full 'megaman PET' that is still coming, but it will take a while, please enjoy this in the mean time.
it supports pebble time, pebble classic, and pebble steel.
------------------
Clock Font: Control Freak [by Apostrophic Labs ]
Date font Font: NovaSquare [by wmk69 ]
  Both are used in accordance with their licensees

latest_release.release_notes:
+Added configuration menu (wip)
+Added the ability to change the animation speed
+added option to enable vibrate on hour (broken)

data.title: Megaman.exe basic

data.description:
Homage to a classic Japanese professional diver's watch from the late 1960s and early 70s.

If you like 6105, check out the 7S26 watchface for a slightly more "modern classic".

latest_release.release_notes: Temporary fix to unexpected bug in new hands-drawing method introduced in v1.2.

data.author: Ed
data.description:
The third in my series of watch faces based on the original BatWatch.

This one honors the men and women from the armed forces that are Airborne.

Wings will be bright when Bluetooth is connected and dark when disconnected.

Wings are full of selected color when battery is full and changes color with battery level.

Options allow changing of colors for different battery levels.
data.title: Airborne Jump Wings Watch

data.author: The Shmu
data.description:
Fuzzy Hebrew by Yos and The Shmu.

Based on "Hebrew Fuzzy" by Abu-Jude using the font from "Hebrew Text Time Display" by Kaneti.
data.title: Fuzzy Hebrew

data.author: Victor Olvera

changelog.release_notes: Fixing the settings URL
Fixing weather API issue
Support for new settings screen. Also adding better settings persistence.

- New white theme added (see settings page). 
- Improved temperature unit and theme persistency. 
- Better bluetooth and battery graphics.

- Adding settings to select either Celsius or Fahrenheit
- Cleaning unused resources and code
First working release.

data.description:
Simple watch face based on LIMITTMM by Albert Salamon. This version include weather, date, bluetooth battery status. Larger centre number is the current hour. As explained in LIMITTMM, each line represents a five minute period. Medium sized line represents quarter. Long line stands for half hour. More colour options and added settings coming soon.

Version 1.1 include option to use Fahrenheit.

Version 1.2 include new white theme.

Version 1.3 new settings screen, better persistence.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixing the settings URL

data.title: Viper Red
